text: Ronnie Walter Cunningham (March 16, 1932 â€“ January 3, 2023) was an American astronaut, fighter pilot and physicist. He was a lunar module pilot on the Apollo 7 mission in 1968. He was one of NASA's first civilian astronauts. He wrote the book The All-American Boys (1977). He was born in Creston, Iowa. Cunningham died of problems caused by a fall on January 3, 2023, in Houston, Texas. He was 90. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website * Category:1932 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:American astronauts Category:American aviators Category:Businesspeople from Iowa Category:Military people from Iowa Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:People from Creston, Iowa Category:Writers from Iowa
title: Walter Cunningham
